org.zoolu.util

Class ByteUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zoolu.util.ByteUtils

  • public class ByteUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that collects static methods for dealing with binary materials.

        Returns:

      • match

        public static boolean match(byte[] buf1,
                            int off1,
                            int len1,
                            byte[] buf2,
                            int off2,
                            int len2)
        Compares two arrays of bytes.
        Parameters:
        buf1 - the buffer containing the first array
        off1 - the offset within the buffer
        len1 - the length of the first array
        buf2 - the buffer containing the second array
        off2 - the offset within the buffer
        len2 - the length of the second array
        Returns:
        true if the two arrays are equal

      • compare

        public static int compare(byte[] a1,
                          byte[] a2)
        Compares two arrays of bytes.
        Parameters:
        a1 - one array
        a2 - the other array
        Returns:
        • 0 if the two arrays are equal;
        • 1 if they are different and, starting from left, all bits are equal and the length of the first array is greater than than the second, or the first bit that differs has value '1' in the first array (and '0' in the second one);
        • -1 if they are different and, starting from left, all bits are equal and the length of the first array is lesser than than the second, or the first bit that differs has value '0' in the first array (and '1' in the second one)

      • compare

        public static int compare(byte[] buf1,
                          int off1,
                          int len1,
                          byte[] buf2,
                          int off2,
                          int len2)
        Compares two arrays of bytes.
        Parameters:
        buf1 - the buffer containing the first array
        off1 - the offset within the buffer
        len1 - the length of the first array
        buf2 - the buffer containing the second array
        off2 - the offset within the buffer
        len2 - the length of the second array
        Returns:
        • 0 if the two arrays are equal;
        • 1 if they are different and, starting from left, all bits are equal and the length of the first array is greater than than the second, or the first bit that differs has value '1' in the first array (and '0' in the second one);
        • -1 if they are different and, starting from left, all bits are equal and the length of the first array is lesser than than the second, or the first bit that differs has value '0' in the first array (and '1' in the second one)

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(byte[] a1,
                          byte[] buf2,
                          int off2,
                          int len2)
        Finds the first occurrence of one array of bytes within a second array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        a1 - the array to be searched
        buf2 - the buffer containing the second array
        off2 - the offset within the second array
        len2 - the length of the second array
        Returns:
        the index within the second array of the first occurrence of the first array, or -1 if not found.

      • uByte

        public static short uByte(byte b)
        Gets the unsigned representation of a byte, returned as a short. The same as getting (short)(b&0xFF).
        Parameters:
        b - the byte value
        Returns:
        the unsigned integer value (as short) of the given byte.

      • uInt

        public static long uInt(int n)
        Gets the unsigned representation of a 32-bit integer, returned as a long. The same as getting (long)n&0x00000000FFFFFFFF.
        Parameters:
        n - the integer value
        Returns:
        the unsigned integer value (as long) of the given integer.

      • bytesToHexString

        public static java.lang.String bytesToHexString(byte[] buf,
                                                int off,
                                                int len)
        Gets a hexadecimal representation of an array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        buf - buffer containing the byte array
        off - the offset within the array
        len - the number of bytes
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal string

      • bytesToFormattedHexString

        public static java.lang.String bytesToFormattedHexString(byte[] data,
                                                         char c,
                                                         int num)
        Gets a formatted (e.g. colon-separated) hexadecimal representation of an array of bytes. The hexadecimal values are formatted in blocks of a given size, separated by a given symbol. Example, in case of two-byte blocks (block size = 2) separated by colons, the string will be formatted as "aabb:ccdd:..:eeff".
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array
        c - the block separator
        num - the number of bytes within each block
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal string

      • bytesToFormattedHexString

        public static java.lang.String bytesToFormattedHexString(byte[] buf,
                                                         int off,
                                                         int len,
                                                         char c,
                                                         int num)
        Gets a formatted (e.g. colon-separated) hexadecimal representation of an array of bytes. The hexadecimal values are formatted in blocks of a given size, separatedby a given symbol. Example, in case of two-byte blocks (block size = 2) separated by colons, the string will be formatted as "aabb:ccdd:..:eeff".
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer containing the byte array
        off - the offset within the array
        len - the length of the array
        c - the block separator
        num - the number of bytes within each block
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal string

      • trimHexString

        public static java.lang.String trimHexString(java.lang.String str)
        Gets an unformatted hexadecimal string. It removes any non-hexadecimal character from the string.
        Parameters:
        str - the formatted hexadecimal string
        Returns:
        the unformatted hexadecimal string

      • asHex

        public static java.lang.String asHex(byte[] data)
        Gets a hexadecimal representation of an array of bytes.

        The same as bytesToHexString(byte[])

        Parameters:
        data - the byte array
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal string

      • asHex

        public static java.lang.String asHex(byte[] buf,
                                     int off,
                                     int len)
        Gets a hexadecimal representation of an array of bytes.

        The same as bytesToHexString(byte[], int, int)

        Parameters:
        buf - buffer containing the byte array
        off - the offset within the array
        len - the number of bytes
        Returns:
        the hexadecimal string

      • hexToBytes

        public static byte[] hexToBytes(java.lang.String str)
        Converts a hexadecimal string into an array of bytes. The string may also include colon ':' characters that separate blocks of hexadecimal values (e.g. aa:bb:cc:dd:..:ff).

        The same as formattedHexStringToBytes(String, char, int) with c=':' and len=-1

        Parameters:
        str - the string with hexadecimal characters possibly separated by colon
        Returns:
        the array of bytes

      • hexToBytes

        public static byte[] hexToBytes(java.lang.String str,
                                int len)
        Converts a hexadecimal string into an array of bytes. The string may also include colon ':' characters that separate blocks of hexadecimal values (e.g. aa:bb:cc:dd:..:ff).

        The same as formattedHexStringToBytes(String, char, int) with c=':'

        Parameters:
        str - the string with hexadecimal characters possibly separated by colon
        len - the length of the array of bytes, or -1 if unknown
        Returns:
        the array of bytes

      • hexToBytes

        public static int hexToBytes(java.lang.String str,
                             byte[] buf,
                             int off)
        Converts a hexadecimal string into an array of bytes. The string may also include colon ':' characters that separate blocks of hexadecimal values (e.g. aa:bb:cc:dd:..:ff).

        The same as formattedHexStringToBytes(String, char, byte[], int) with c=':'

        Parameters:
        str - the string with hexadecimal characters possibly separated by colon
        buf - the buffer where the array of bytes will be written
        off - the offset within the buffer
        Returns:
        the length of the array of bytes

      • bytesToAsciiString

        public static java.lang.String bytesToAsciiString(byte[] data)
        Gets an ASCII representation of an array of bytes. Non-ASCII bytes are encoded as '.'.
        Parameters:
        data - the array of bytes
        Returns:
        the ASCII string

      • bytesToAsciiString

        public static java.lang.String bytesToAsciiString(byte[] buf,
                                                  int off,
                                                  int len)
        Gets an ASCII representation of an array of bytes. Non-ASCII bytes are encoded as '.'.
        Parameters:
        buf - buffer containing the array of bytes
        off - the offset within the buffer
        len - the number of bytes
        Returns:
        the ASCII string

      • asAscii

        public static java.lang.String asAscii(byte[] data)
        Gets an ASCII representation of an array of bytes. Non-ASCII bytes are encoded as '.'.

        The same as bytesToAsciiString(byte[])

        Parameters:
        data - the array of bytes
        Returns:
        the ASCII string

      • twoBytesToInt

        public static int twoBytesToInt(byte[] src)
        Transforms a two-byte array into a 16-bit integer; the 2-byte array is in big-endian byte order (the big end, most significant byte, is stored first, at the lowest storage address).
        Parameters:
        src - the two-byte array representing an integer in big-endian byte order
        Returns:
        the 16-bit integer

      • twoBytesToInt

        public static int twoBytesToInt(byte[] src,
                                int off)
        Reads a 16-bit integer from a two-byte array; the two-byte array is in big-endian byte order (the big end, most significant byte, is stored first, at the lowest storage address).
        Parameters:
        src - a buffer containing the two-byte array representing an integer in big-endian byte order
        off - the offset within the buffer
        Returns:
        the 16-bit integer

        Parameters:
        src - the four-byte array representing an integer in little-endian byte order
        Returns:
        the 16-bit integer

        Parameters:
        val - the 16-bit integer
        Returns:
        a two-byte array representing the given integer, in big-endian byte order

                                 byte[] dst,
                                 int off)
        Writes a 16-bit integer into a two-byte array in big-endian byte order (the big end, most significant byte, is stored first, at the lowest storage address).
        Parameters:
        val - the 16-bit integer
        dst - a buffer for the two-byte big-endian representation of the given integer
        off - the offset within the buffer

                                             int off)

        dst - a buffer for the two-byte little-endian representation of the given integer
        off - the offset within the buffer

      • invertByteOrder

        public static void invertByteOrder(byte[] buf)
        Modifies the given array inverting the byte order. It transforms little-endian to big-endian n-bytes array (and vice versa).
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer containing the array

      • inc

        public static void inc(byte[] buf)
        Adds 1 to the number represented by the given array of bytes, module 2^n, where n is the length (in bits) of the array.
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer containing the array

      • twoBytesToInt

        public static int twoBytesToInt(byte b_high,
                                byte b_low)
        Gets a 16-bit integer from two bytes.
        Parameters:
        b_high - high byte
        b_low - low byte
        Returns:
        the 16-bit integer value

      • fourBytesToLong

        public static long fourBytesToLong(byte b3,
                                   byte b2,
                                   byte b1,
                                   byte b0)
        Gets a 32-bit integer (as long) from four bytes.
        Parameters:
        b3 - the fourth byte
        b2 - the third byte
        b1 - the second byte
        b0 - the first byte
        Returns:
        the 32-bit integer value
